ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I feel like my knowledge of Spanish vocabulary and grammar improved.
I really developed an initial understanding of the Spanish language that I can tell has already benefited how I view and interact with the world as a global entity.
Felt like I gained an introduction to the Spanish language.
We covered the basic grammar and tenses up to preterite. I learned how to make simple conversations in Spanish. Overall a really fun course.
I learned basic grammar, MANY vocab words, and how to carry on basic conversations.
I learned the basics of the Spanish language and how to speak it.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think that we should have focused on speaking in class more.
Less homework perhaps? Also the cost of the book & course packet were high.
It's a very well structured course. The exams and supersite homework are designed to help us improve our ability to use Spanish in every way. I wish we could interact more in Spanish during class.
The course is overall very well! I think it moves a bit fast, but I guess that's Yale for you.
I think the course was well taught and I also liked the use of Spanish fully in the class. It was a quick transition, but hearing the language more often helped with everything else.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I'd recommend it. I think that Professor Garcia is a good teacher. She will help you improve your Spanish skills, and she is frequently available during office hours.
I would absolutely recommend this course to another student because learning another language is an essential aspect of being a part of the global community we live in.
Yes, if you want a strong foundation in spanish.
Yes. If you need a language credit, Spanish is a great course to take and a great language to learn.
Yes if a student is trying to learn spanish, this is a great first course.
I would recommend this course to another student that is interested in learning a new language. It was a good introductory class.
